title: Grasshopper for Revit Cheat Sheet Manual
author: Marcello Sgambelluri, PE, SE
description: A book with 200+ examples and workflows using side by side defintions on Grasshopper and Dynamo in Revit. A must for anyone that  Revit

title: 101 Class LiveAcademy
author: Oliver Thomas, BIG
description: In this 1-hour course Oliver Thomas from BIG will cover the basics of the Rhino.Inside interface, components and workflows whilst working on a real-world project workflow

title: Building Systems Specialist Course
author: PAZ Academy
description: A complete cirricullum on Parametric BIM Modeling. This extenive course results in the BSS TITLE focused on Rhino.Inside Revit + Rhinoceros & Grasshopper

title: Complete Workshop for Rhino.Inside.Revit
author: McNeel
description: A 3 hour workshop conducted by Scott Davidson and Ehsan Iran-Nejad from Robert McNeel & Associates

title: Quick Course on Rhino/Grasshopper
author: Aussie BIM Guru
description: This video serves as a crash course to get you orientated into Rhino, Grasshopper and Revit.  This will help come to terms with the basic interface/functions to get you started with this integrated platform

title: Parametric Monkey Primer
author: Paul Wintour @ Parametric Monkey
description: With the release of Rhino.Inside.Revit, a whole range of new interoperability possibilities now exist. We've been working with our clients to integrate Grasshopper scripts with Revit, and developed this quick tutorial to help them get up and running. Hopefully it helps you too

title: Rhino.Inside.Revit Happy Hour Webinar
author: Marcello Sgambelluri, PE, SE
description: Marcello shows Rhino.Inside.Revit... That's right, you can run Rhino (and Grasshopper) inside of Revit. Hosted by [The Revit Kid](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC6TtKCInvnoU7vLNACZRFrQ)

title: 101 Class Live Academy with Oliver from BIG
author: Oliver Thomas, BIG
description: In this 1-hour course Olly will cover the basics of the Rhino.Inside interface, components and workflows whilst working on a real-world project workflow

title: AECbytes Rhino.Inside.Revit
author: AECBytes Blog
description: A 5-star presentation from Håvard Vasshaug of the Bad Monkeys group to [Snøhetta](https://www.snohetta.com/). If you know Revit and want to know how your workflow might be improved, watch this

title: Rhino.Inside.Revit Review
author: Håvard Vasshaug
description: A 5-star presentation from Håvard Vasshaug of the Bad Monkeys group to [Snøhetta](https://www.snohetta.com/). If you know Revit and want to know how your workflow might be improved, watch this

title: Aussie BIM Guru Video Series on Rhino.Inside.Revit
author: Gavin Crump
description: Gavin Crump kicks off a series on Rhino.Inside.Revit with a 5 part series - the new tool which connects Rhino and Revit together! Gavin thinks Grasshopper in Revit is a massive breakthrough for computational designers. In this first part, he covers how to bake out elements from Revit into Rhino using filtering criteria. In the next parts we will cover reading and setting parameter values in Revit

title: Seattle SeaRUG presentation of Rhino-to-Revit Workflows
author: Joseph Fruend, Microsol @ Seattle Revit User Group
description: Microsol AEC Application Specialist Joseph Freund shows the Seattle Revit User's Group showing some features of Rhino.Inside Revit and Rhino 7, including Subd.

title: Rhino.Inside.Revit with Geometry Gym
author: Geometry Gym
description: This video runs through the basics of Rhino.Inside.Revit and how to get up and running with this exciting new technology. Along with Geometry Gym tools with an eye toward facades and structures

title: Structural framing from Grasshopper to Revit
author: Structured Parametrics
description: Tutorial on how to get grasshopper structural framing into Revit with Rhino.Inside. This shows how quick it can be to get framing into Revit but also shows some of the issues with the current workflow for this Work In Progress project.

title: Rhino.Inside.Revit, Clash Detection, Grasshopper player, SubD
author: Structured Parametrics
description: Rhino 7 has been released! See a quick preview of new features with a focus on what will be useful for Engineers.

title: How-to-Rhino Tutorial
author: How to Rhino Facebook Group
description: This is a short recap of Rhino.Inside.Revit plugin which allows Revit and other apps to run Rhino and Grasshopper within Revit application. Keep in mind that this works only with Rhino 7 work in progress version. With this plugin, you can easily import and export geometry from Revit to Rhino and Grasshopper and the other way around. As this is a native McNeel development tool, it is going to be a game changer when it comes to having the ability to use parametric modeling techniques in Grasshopper and have all of that work seamlessly in a BIM tool such as Revit

title: Aussie BIM Guru Adding Revit data to Rhino models using Rhino Inside.
author: Gavin Crump
description: Nifty little workflow today, basically using Elefront to 'inject' BIM data from Revit into Rhino, including layers by category. Huge time saver!

title: Aussie BIM Guru Selecting Rhino elements by Revit properties
author: Gavin Crump
description: Using a data rich Rhino model, we can mine this data to select elements the same way we could in Revit - Rhivit, pwhoah!

title: Becoming a computational designer with Rhino.Inside.Revit
author: The Creative Insider Podcast
description: Olly Thomas is a BIM Specialist at BIG New York. Olly is also part of the international architectural collective PIXELS Among all the activities he does he also educates people about parametrical design and BIM and how to make your ideas buildable.

title: SF Computational Design Institute presentation of Rhino.Inside.Revit
author: San Francisco Computational Design Institute
description: This is a short recap of Rhino.Inside.Revit plugin and Compute technology in Rhino

title: AIA Detroit co.de.D Rhino.Inside.Revit Presentation
author: AIA Detroit co.DE.D Group
description: Rhino.Inside allows you to use Grasshopper directly within Revit. Will this replace Dynamo or enhance it? Join co.de.D as we discuss what Rhino.Inside means for our industry

title: Creating Windows with Rhino.Inside.Revit
author: How To Rhino
description: In this Rhino Inside Revit tutorial, we’re going to create windows in Revit based on geometry input from Rhino and Grasshopper. This method allows the use of both parametric and manual positioning for our families that are being created directly from Grasshopper

title: EvolveLAB covers Rhino.Inside.Revit - Way Faster Wednesday
author: EvolveLAB
description: In this video, we highlight the power of Rhino.Inside.Revit with Grasshopper. We will place adaptive components and floors using rhino inside with grasshopper

title: Rhino Inside Revit - Creating Walls Tutorial
author: How to Rhino
description: We will also go over a couple of simple Grasshopper definitions that will be used to create walls directly in Revit. You will learn how to completely control the walls component for Rhino Inside and we will use Enscape together with Revit.

title: Solar Analysis with Rhino.Inside.Revit
author: Paul Wintour @ Parametric Monkey
description: One of the most frequent requests I receive is about running solar access analysis within Revit. Despite the fact that it is still quicker and more accurate to export to Grasshopper, run the analysis and push the results back, many still prefer to stay within Revit. So I decided to do a quick proof-of-concept and I'm proud to announce that it works perfectly using Rhino.Inside.Revit

title: Lands Design running inside Revit
author: Lands Design
description: This video shows how to generate terrains and plants in Revit using Lands Design, running as a plug-in for Revit with the Rhino Inside technology.

title: Room Data and View Analysis with Rhino.Inside.Revit
author: Rethinking BIM
description: This video goes through a workflow that uses Rhino.Inside and the View Rose tool in Ladybug (Grasshopper plugin) in order to demonstrate the process of running a geometry-focused analysis in Rhino/Grasshopper and feeding results back into a Revit parameter.

title: Intro to Rhino.Inside.Revit
author: Rethinking BIM
description: This video provides an intro to some of the capabilities of Rhino.Inside.Revit

title: Room Data and View Analysis with Rhino.Inside.Revit
author: Rethinking BIM
description: This video goes through a workflow that uses Rhino.Inside and the View Rose tool in Ladybug (Grasshopper plugin) in order to demonstrate the process of running a geometry-focused analysis in Rhino/Grasshopper and feeding results back into a Revit parameter

title: Optimizing your Rhino-to-Revit Workflow
author: Joseph Fruend, Microsol @ Philadelphia Dynamo User Group
description: Microsol AEC Application Specialist Joseph Freund will share tips and tricks for a seamless Rhino-to-Revit workflow, eliminating needless importing/exporting so that models can be cleanly integrated into the final production environment.

title: Adaptive Components driven by Data generated in Ladybug/Grasshopper
author: Rethinking BIM
description: This tutorial demonstrates the process of placing an adaptive component and assigning a parameter value to that component using geometry and analysis data generated in Grasshopper.

title: Rename Multiple Revit Models Levels with RhinoInside and Excel Data
author: Junghwo Park @ PointOneStudio
description: PointOneStudio introduces a workflow of automatically updating the level names and heights of Revits domain models using RhinoInside and Excel Data.

title: How to create custom Revit region with Rhino
author: Junghwo Park @ PointOneStudio
description: PointOneStudio shows how to create complex hatch for revit by using Rhino's Hatch Maker plug-in.

title: Rhino.Inside.Revit - Parametric Twisting Tower
author: Lorenzo Lencioni and Alberto Nann
description: The potential of a parametric modeling software like Grasshopper is undeniable, like those of Building Information Modeling BIM offered by Revit.

title: Place Beams in Rhino.Inside.Revit
author: Marcello Sgambelluri @ Simply Complex Podcast
description: In this video I show you how to simplify Revit structural beam modeling using an adaptive component and Rhino.Inside.Revit

title: BIMThoughts on PyRevit and Rhino.Inside.Revit
author: BIMThoughts Podcast
description: In this episode we chat with the very busy Ehsan Iran-Nejad about his amazing add-in for Revit call pyRevit. We also chat with Ehsan about his work at McNeel on the Rhino.Inside.Revit integration.

title: Create Building Shell Using Adaptive Components
author: McNeel
description: This sample shows how to how to drive adaptive components using Grasshopper and Rhino

title: Analytical Model Manipulation
author: McNeel
description: This example takes a look at working with Revit analytical models using Rhino.Inside.Revit

title: Create and Place Column Family Along Curve
author: McNeel
description: This sample shows how to create a new Revit family that contains geometry created in Rhino and Grasshopper

title: Creating Wall in Revit
author: McNeel
description: This sample shows how to take normal Rhino curve and create a set of Revit system family walls

title: Getting User Input using Human UI
author: McNeel
description: The example here requires the [HumanUI plugin for Grasshopper](https://www.food4rhino.com/app/human-ui). This is a plugin allowing Grasshopper to design and display dialog box interfaces. In this case the dialog interface will help edit the *Drawn by* and the *Checked by* sections of the title block

title: Creating Roof From Wall Edges
author: McNeel
description: This sample shows how to Select Revit Element edges as input to a Grasshopper lofted surface. Using Revit objects as input to Grasshopper definitions allows for a dynamic editing directly in Revit and making Grasshopper interactive within the the Revit model

title: Transfer Revit to Rhino
author: McNeel
description: This sample shows how to take Revit objects into Rhino

title: Transfer Rhino to Revit
author: McNeel
description: This sample shows how to take normal Rhino breps, curves and points into Revit. There are a lot of ways to bring in the Rhino geometry, but in this case we will be bringing them in as DirectShape elements

title: Extract Window Geometry and Material by Sub-Categories
author: McNeel
description: The first part of this definition, collects subcategories available on *Windows Category* in the active document

title: Update Door Marks
author: McNeel
description: This sample shows how to updated properties on Revit elements
